subject: Re: [junit] displaying multiple errors from the same condition
msgSnippet: David, It is much better to generate suite and let the runner to iterate trough tests and mark failed urls. See somehow shortened version of the test case
messageBody:
David,

It is much better to generate suite and let the runner to iterate
trough tests and mark failed urls. See somehow shortened version of the
test case below (shortened, because usually people using FailedTestCase
instead of mergig its code into the test class).
Note getName() methods below.
Also note that testInvalidUrl() will always fail pointing to the line
with "new URL(url)".

public class SampleTest extends TestCase {
private static String[] URLS = {...};

private String url;
private URL u;
private Exception ex;

public SampleTest(String url) throws MalformedURLException {
super("testUrl");
this.url = url;
this.u = new URL(url);
}

public SampleTest( String url, Exception ex) {
super("testInvalidUrl");
this.ex = ex;
this.url = url;
}

public String getName() {
return super.getName()+" "+url;
}

public void testUrl() {
// test
}

public void testInvalidUrl() throws Exception {
throw ex;
}

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
for( int i = 0; i < URLS.length; i++) {
try {
suite.addTest(new SampleTest(URLS[i]));
} catch(MalformedURLException ex) {
suite.addTest(new SampleTest(URLS[i], ex));
}
}
return suite;
}

}





regards,
Eugene
